newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks hold strong gains in late trading.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks hold strong gains in late trading.

text.p: U.S. stocks held strong gains in late trading on Thursday, with a rally in bonds leading investors to put a positive spin on the impact of a capital gains tax cut.
The Dow was up about 112 points, or 1.5 percent, to 7196 after hitting a session peak of 7215.
Traders said investors appeared to be taking the view that a capital gains tax cut would be a long-term positive for stocks and attract further money to equities.
The long bond rose 15/32 to yield 6.93, giving up some ground from its session peaks.
